title: Teammates give up absurdly easily
body:
For at least 50% of my games in the last few days, there has been at least one person on my team who has asked for ff at 20 or open mid when we were only 2 kills down (often without a tower even having gone down).

This is absolute stupidity.  Because we were a duo, my brother and I were able to prevent the surrender vote, and won most of those games anyways (we scaled better than the enemy team too).

I have never had such consistently frustrating teammates in this game.  It seriously feels like it happens every game now.

Isn't there something that can be done about this?  I still enjoy the game overall, but it's become much more about keeping your teammates happy than actually playing against your opponents.  My teammates seem much more my opponents than the other team.

> 
> Isn&#039;t there something that can be done about this?  I still enjoy the game overall, but it&#039;s become much more about keeping your teammates happy than actually playing against your opponents.  My teammates seem much more my opponents than the other team.

That's the mentality of the casual gamer and those children that were coddled being raised by passive parents. It gets hard so they quit because they don't know any better. They will live long boring unsuccessful lives because of it. Winners don't quit.

People like this will make every excuse in the book but it's human nature that if you fail real life you will bring that same fail attitude to anything you do. A winner won't.

Don't be taken by that sorry excuse that they lead a successful life and play games to relax and have fun because it's bullshit. Successful people can relax and have fun playing games too but I bet any amount of money that they win a lot more than these quitting failures.

Solo Q in a nutshell, from bronze to silver!:

{{champion:16}} *First Blood*
{{champion:67}} gg open mid *afks*
Don't feed? That seems like a good idea or just ff and don't trap people in a game that they don't want to play.

We've won a good portion of those games.  I'm not going to encourage people giving up in easily winnable games.  I also wouldn't call 0/2 feeding.

0/4 maybe, but 0/1 or 0/2 is just being a bit behind.

If they don't want to play more than 10 minutes, they shouldn't queue up for a min. 20 minute game.
If the person that goes 0/2 doesn't change the way they are playing it's just another loss. Wasting time hoping for a comeback is a waste of player's time.

How are you supposed to know 10 minutes into the game how good they'll be in the mid-late game?

Laning phase is my weakest part of the game, but my mid and especially late game are quite strong.  Also we did make a comeback most games, so clearly it wasn't wasted time.
That's the magic of lethality meta, no one lives for more than 3 seconds, thus tilting everyone.
